result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cierra M. Robinson

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on December 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Attorney Jessica Phelps appears by phone; Defendant appears in person
DATES: 
FPT/TPD 12-22-22 at 1:45 pm

Clerk: Micki
Case Called at: 8:44 a.m.
INCLUDES 22CF370, 22CF514, and 22CM136.

State appears by ADA Hannah Runde for DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, pro se. She does have Atty Phelps. 
 
Date and time set for bond forfeiture hearing. VRCW.

COURT questions Defendant re: missed appearance. Defendant makes statement. 
COURT vacates order for bail/bond forfeiture.

CC - 10/27/22 at 8:05 a.m. (defendant must appear)

Adj: 8:48 a.m.

INCLUDES 22CF370, 22CF514, 22CM136: No contact with victim(s): E.P.H., T.G.S. or Reliance Inn. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:58 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF370, 22CF514, 22CM136.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Natasha VanLieshout. 

Date and time set for warrant quash; COURT quashes any outstanding warrants.  

BOND:  $5000.00 signature bond to include all files. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): E.P.H., T.G.S. or Reliance Inn. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No possession of drug paraphernalia. 
- Prints and photograph. 

BFH:  10/24/22 at 8:30 a.m. 

Adj:  3:01 p.m. 

Branch 6.
Brought to jail on 09/05/22 by Wausau PD.

3:50 PM 
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF370, 22CF514, and 22CM136

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant fails to appear, Attorney Jessica Phelps appears in person.

Date and time set for a JPTC. VRCW.
Atty Phelps makes statement regarding defendant's whereabouts. 
DDA Lawrence is requesting a BW due to defendant's non-appearance.
COURT notes notice was given for today's hearing.  
COURT authorizes $1,500.00 bench warrant on all files.  

Date:
BFH - 10/24/22 at 8:30 a.m.

ADJ: 3:54 p.m.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on August 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:30 AM 
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF370, 22CF514, and 22CM136

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, in custody from the MCJ with Attorney Jessica Phelps.

Date and time set for a JSH. VRCW.

Attorney Phelps makes statement regarding resolution and date/time.
DDA Lawrence in agreement.  Asks for the JT to be removed.
COURT strikes JT date from the calendar.

Dates:
JPTC/TPD: 8/30/22 at 3:30p.m.

ADJ: 11:32a.m.
